snippet: The order would bar federal contractors from discriminating on the basis of sexual orientation and gender identity.
abstract: More than 50 constitutional law professors urge Pres Obama not to include religious exemption in expected order barring federal contractors from discriminating on basis of sexual orientation and gender identity; say church groups are already allowed to favor members of their faith in hiring, and that new exception would allow employers to discriminate using taxpayer dollars and enshrine a second-class legal status for gay, lesbian and transgender workers.
lead_paragraph: The order would bar federal contractors from discriminating on the basis of sexual orientation and gender identity.

headline.main: Group of Law Professors Urges Obama to Deny Religious Exemption in Order
headline.print_headline: Group of Law Professors Urges Obama to Deny Religious Exemption in Order
